pullRequest.body:
Deprecate stdBasis in favor of its duplicate LinearMap.single. Also changes the binder types in the later.

Note the `simp` normal form of an applied (or even simply coerced to function) `LinearMap.single` is a `Pi.single`, as discussed during the community meeting.

See the [Zulip discussion](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/LinearMap.2EstdBasis/near/457515331).

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [76ec36d5b7](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15660/commits/76ec36d5b773d9456592694684f3dedab6ce7e44)

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.RingTheory.MvPowerSeries.Basic | 928 | 899 | -29 (-3.12%) |
| Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Pi | 610 | 611 | +1 (+0.16%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.MvPowerSeries.Trunc` `Mathlib.RingTheory.MvPowerSeries.Basic`|-29|
|<details><summary>5 files</summary> `Mathlib.RingTheory.PowerSeries.WellKnown` `Mathlib.RingTheory.HahnSeries.PowerSeries` `Mathlib.RingTheory.PowerSeries.Order` `Mathlib.RingTheory.PowerSeries.Trunc` `Mathlib.RingTheory.PowerSeries.Basic`</details>|-28|
| `Mathlib.RingTheory.MvPowerSeries.Inverse` `Mathlib.RingTheory.MvPowerSeries.NoZeroDivisors`|-20|
|<details><summary>4 files</summary> `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Multilinear.Basic` `Mathlib.Algebra.Category.ModuleCat.Products` `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.Pi` `Mathlib.Topology.LocallyConstant.Algebra`</details>|1|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Matrix.toBilin'Aux_single`
`+ Matrix.toBilin'_single`
`+ Matrix.toLinearMap₂'Aux_single`
`+ Matrix.toLinearMap₂'_single`
`+ Matrix.toLinearMapₛₗ₂'_single`
`+ basis_repr_single`
`+ diagonal_comp_single`
`+ disjoint_single_single`
`+ dotProduct_single_one`
`+ equivFun_symm_single`
`+ iInf_ker_proj_le_iSup_range_single`
`+ iSup_range_single`
`+ iSup_range_single_eq_iInf_ker_proj`
`+ iSup_range_single_le_iInf_ker_proj`
`+ ker_single`
`+ linearIndependent_single`
`+ mulVec_single_one`
`+ proj_comp_single`
`+ proj_comp_single_ne`
`+ proj_comp_single_same`
`+ single_apply`
`+ single_eq_pi_diag`
`+ single_one_dotProduct`
`+ single_one_vecMul`
`- LinearMap.BilinForm.toMatrixAux_stdBasis`
`- Matrix.toBilin'Aux_stdBasis`
`- Matrix.toLinearMap₂'Aux_stdBasis`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

> or even simply coerced to function

To me this choice is not obviously the right one (vs only making the applied version `simp`), but nor is it obviously wrong.

> What do you think of my suggestions below to replace all occurences of `LinearMap.single R (fun _ => R) i c` with `Pi.single i c`? That makes the spelling simp-normal, which would allow a fair number of lemmas to also be `@[simp]`.
> 
> 

I don't really know what API boundaries you want to keep here.

> I don't really know what API boundaries you want to keep here.

I'm deliberately saying that there should be no API boundary between `Pi.single` and `LinearMap.single`; the rule is that the latter should only exist in lemmas where it is not applied (or if Patrick prefers, not coerced), as is the case with most bundled maps with a corresponding unbundled spelling.

:v: PatrickMassot can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10339111731/job/28618061708)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10339111731/job/28618061836)

What do you think of my suggestions below to replace all occurences of `LinearMap.single R (fun _ => R) i c` with `Pi.single i c`? That makes the spelling simp-normal, which would allow a fair number of lemmas to also be `@[simp]`.

bors d+

Please check the changes I pushed look ok. Thanks for doing the bulk of the work here!

I think I'd argue this should be
```suggestion
    b.equivFun.symm (Pi.single i 1) = b i := by
```
which would then make it safe to be `simp` too.
Here too I think I'd argue for `Pi.single` on the RHS
And here
This lemma strikes me as very strange; I'd argue that any user of it should be using `Finsupp.single_eq_pi_single` directly.

I'd propose we delete these and `single_apply'` and `single_apply` too, and poitn the deprecations directly at the `Pi.single` lemmas. I'll push a change to that effect once everything else is passing.
(I did this)
It looks like the deprecation for this one is missing

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor: deprecate stdBasis
